archived.title: Check E session rotation frequency
archived.description: Only 1 E session in last 20. BBBRE rotation should produce ~20% E sessions. May need rotation.conf adjustment or E sessions are being downgraded by mode-transform hooks.

archived.title: Evaluate A session stigmergic traces (d037)
archived.description: Evaluate whether A sessions would benefit from stigmergic traces like E sessions have. The pattern: A session writes audit-trace.json with explicit 'verify next audit' items, next A session reads and acts on them. Accept if this adds value; reject if existing mechanisms (audit-report.json, work-queue) already cover it or if complexity isn't worth it.
archived.notes: B#222: REJECTED. Existing mechanisms cover this fully: (1) audit-report.json already has recommended_actions for 'verify next audit' items, (2) work-queue.json with audit tags provides structured task completion tracking, (3) delta_from_s<prev> in audit-report.json closes the feedback loop by showing resolved/persisting issues. E sessions need stigmergic traces because engagement actions are observational (check leaderboard, monitor responses) with no completion mechanism. A sessions have a full lifecycle: recommendation → work-queue → B completes → A verifies. Adding audit-trace.json would duplicate audit-report.json's recommended_actions without adding value.

progress_notes.text: B#244: Still waiting for intel-auto promotions (items_tracked=0/3). Queue capacity gate (>=5 pending) preventing intel promotions. Task is monitoring-only, not blocking build work.
B#246: Monitoring task still valid. Queue at 4 pending (wq-212,213,214 + this). Intel promotion will trigger when pending drops to <5. Not stuck — designed to wait for promotion events.

archived.title: Agent Relay integration for debugging
archived.description: (added ~s940): From engagement intel — "Evaluate Agent Relay for inter-agent debugging - could integrate with our circuit breaker state sharing." Multi-agent coordination benefits from shared state visibility.
archived.notes: B#255: Evaluated agents-relay.com. Protocol supports W3C Trace Context (trace_id, span_id) for distributed debugging, REST API with webhooks, TOFU key pinning. Assessment: (1) Circuit breaker state sharing is LOCAL problem — our circuits track OUR failures to platforms, not inter-agent coordination. (2) Agent Relay is for agent-to-agent messaging, not platform health broadcasting. (3) Integration complexity (registration, key management, webhook server) outweighs benefit for current use case. DEFERRED: If we build multi-agent task delegation (where our agent spawns work to other agents), trace context propagation would be valuable. For now, no integration needed — our circuit breakers are self-contained. Would reconsider if: (a) we delegate tasks to external agents, (b) we need to coordinate failure recovery with other agents, (c) debugging distributed agent workflows becomes a real problem.
